valid_articles.Title: Yep, this was an interesting one. I noticed Barry's articles had image issues in Google Discover and pinged him about it. Little did we know there was a big AWS issue that was causing Google to see the images as 404s. Barry covers more about the case in his post. From Barry:…
valid_articles.Description: Glenn Gabe highlights a case study by Barry Schwartz where an AWS S3 issue caused images to be served as 404 errors to Googlebot, impacting visibility in Google Discover. The incident underscores the potential consequences of technical issues on search performance.

valid_articles.Title: "The first of its kind from a major AI vendor" -> Anthropic publishes the ‘system prompts’ that make Claude tick "The latest prompts, dated July 12, outline very clearly what the Claude models can’t do — e.g. “Claude cannot open URLs, links, or videos.” Facial recognition is a…
valid_articles.Description: Glenn Gabe shares news about Anthropic publishing the system prompts for its Claude AI model, offering transparency into its capabilities and limitations. The prompts reveal that Claude cannot interact with external content like URLs and videos, and facial recognition is restricted.

valid_articles.Title: Back in mid-June, AWS S3 blocked Googlebot, resulting in my images not working in Google Search & Discover. AWS fixed the issue but the damage has been done - a rare case study from yours truly (this was a big issue)
valid_articles.Description: Barry Schwartz shares a personal experience where an AWS S3 configuration issue blocked Googlebot from accessing images on his website, negatively impacting his performance in Google Search and Discover. The incident serves as a cautionary tale about the importance of proper server configurations.

valid_articles.Title: Google Local Knowledge Panel maps is testing not taking you to Google Maps but rather expanding the map on the search results page

This potential change could impact user behavior and local SEO strategies.

valid_articles.Title: Google Doesn't Try Variations Of URLs
valid_articles.Description: John Mueller, a Google Search Advocate, confirms that Googlebot does not typically experiment with URL variations to find working pages. This information clarifies that Googlebot primarily relies on submitted URLs and links for crawling and indexing.
